messageBody:
> From: Oisin Kim [mailto:oisin.kim@...]
>
> Hi J.B and thanks for your reply,
>
> I've fixed the problem here which was due to a Custom ClassLoader
> which was written and didn't behave as it was expected to, I've
> inherited this code, its used to proved a clean classloader
> environment to tests, so that test methods have clean static instances
> for every test run.
>
> Since I've fixed the problem, I thought I'd post the "fix" for review,
> I'm simply here trying to give each test method call a clean
> environment and allow it to initialize everything itself

Hi,

The only thing I saw that looks off is calling loader.findClass(...). Custom classloaders should override loadClass(), not findClass(). findClass() should be called automatically, if necessary, by the JVM's ClassLoader. Typically if you violate the ClassLoader API contract like this you'll run into nasty problems like the problems JUnit has with reloading classes.

Why not just take JUnit and customize/fix the source for your needs? Certainly would be easier for someone like me to comprehend your changes here, since I am more familiar with JUnit's code than your project's code. There are definitely some corners in JUnit where you'll find it necessary (and usually much easier) to modify JUnit itself to do what you want.

Best,
Scott Stirling
